page.title: 12The St Leger Family,Firbeck
page.content: About two hundred years ago a famous family called the{St Legers}lived at {Park Hill in Firbeck.}They were a very rich family. All that is left of{Park {Hill}now is an old garden wall and a part of a boiler house. {Mr St Leger } asked another man to have a race to see whose horse was the fastest.They rode it in an oval shaped field just outside{Firbeck.}It was held in {1776 It is 550 yards at the narrowest and 760 yards at the widest.The circumference is about 2000 yards or 9 furlongs.This was the first ever {St. Leger} race.The St Leger is now run at {Doncaster.}
